argument.description: Optional. The number of decimal places to truncate to. This value must be a positive or negative integer.

description: The PostgreSQL trunc function returns a number truncated to a certain number of decimal places.
sample:
postgres=# SELECT trunc(125.315);
 trunc
-------
   125
(1 row)

postgres=# SELECT trunc(125.315, 0);
 trunc
-------
   125
(1 row)

postgres=# SELECT trunc(125.315, 1);
 trunc
-------
 125.3
(1 row)

postgres=# SELECT trunc(125.315, 2);
 trunc
--------
 125.31
(1 row)

postgres=# SELECT trunc(125.315, -1);
 trunc
-------
   120
(1 row)

postgres=# SELECT trunc(125.315, -2);
 trunc
-------
   100
(1 row)

postgres=# SELECT trunc(-125.315);
 trunc
-------
  -125
(1 row)
